text:
I don't have much experience with this, but when I was working with my contract attorney (for CA-based law) they told me that non-competes and non-solicitation agreements cannot be enforced in the state. Many other areas also have a similar stance.

So I'm not sure you could really monetize an ongoing broker fee. One-off commissions would be more manageable.

If you were to do more hands on work like "editing" and value adds, then you could have the "pass through" revenue, but you would also be managing work.

Off the top of my head, the best example of a model you could emulate is staffing agencies such as Creative Circle.
